data.title: The Last Remaining Independent Cinema in Long Beach
data.text:
WELCOME

TO THE ART THEATRE

The Art Theatre originally opened in 1924 as a single screen silent movie house. At that time, there were over 50 independent theatres in Long Beach, today only the Art remains.

RENT THE ART

HOST YOUR EVENT AT THE THEATER

The Art Theatre is the perfect venue for a wide variety of private events. With our state of the art digital sound system and projection, our equipment is second to none in Long Beach.

Stay up to date with Art Theatre news and events

Leave this field empty if you're human:

In-Theatre Viewing

Thelma

(1hr 38min PG-13) 2024 US Josh Margolin, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Wednesday, August 21 | 4:45pm

When 93-year-old Thelma Post gets duped by a phone scammer pretending to be her grandson, she sets out on a treacherous quest across the city to reclaim what was taken from her.

Purple Rain, 40th Anniversary!

(1h 51m R) 1984 US Albert Magnoli, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | August 21st | 7:15pm

A young musician, tormented by an abusive situation at home, must contend with a rival singer, a burgeoning romance, and his own dissatisfied band, as his star begins to rise.

Art After Dark: I Saw the TV Glow

(1h 40m PG-13) 2024 US Jane Schoenbrun, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Friday, August 23rd | 10:00pm

Two teenagers bond over their love of a supernatural TV show, but it is mysteriously cancelled.

Happy SundaysE-Tickets | Click Here | Saturday, August 24 | eventbrite

Happy Sundays FREE Music, Comedy & Space Fest

AEROSPACE TALKS AT LONG BEACH ART THEATRE W/ JASON ACHILLES - ROCKETS & ROCK N’ ROLL • JEFF MEGIVERN - ROCKET SCIENTIST AT NASA JPL • BOBBY VAN NESS - SPACECRAFT ROBOTICS ENGINEER

visit happysundaysfest.com for more info!

Pulp Fiction, 30th Anniversary!

(2h 34m R) 1994 US Quentin Tarantino, director

E-Tickets | Click here | August 24 - 29

The lives of two mob hitmen, a boxer, a gangster and his wife, and a pair of diner bandits intertwine in four tales of violence and redemption.

Long Beach Women's Fair presents... Still Working 9 to 5 (FREE SCREENING)

(1h 31m NR) 2022 US Camille Hardman & Gary Lane, director

NO RSVP REQUIRED | Free Admission | Monday, August 26th | 8:00pm

When #1 comedy, 9 to 5, starring Jane Fonda, Dolly Parton, Dabney Coleman and Lily Tomlin, exploded on the screens in 1980, the laughs hid a serious message about women in the office. Still Working 9 to 5 explores 40 years of inequality.

See It on 16mm: Kansas City Bomber

(1hr 39min PG) 1972 US Jerrold Freedman, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Friday, August 30th | 7:00pm

Roller derby skater K.C. Carr tries to balance her desire for a happy personal life and her dreams of stardom.

Art After Dark: The Science of Sleep

(1hr 45min R) 2006 US Michel Gondry ("Eternal Sunshine of Spotless Mind"), director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Friday, August 30th | 10:00pm

A man entranced by his dreams and imagination is love-struck with a French woman and feels he can show her his world.

Andrei Tarkovsky's NOSTALGHIA

(2hr 5min NR) 1983 Russia

E-Tickets | Click Here | August 31st

To investigate the life of Russian composer Pavel Sosnovsky, Andrei Gorchakov goes to Italy, where Sosnovsky resided before his suicide. Joining Gorkachov on his journey through Tuscany is his interpreter, Eugenia, who develops an interest in her client that is more than professional. Meanwhile, Gorkachov is beset by powerful feelings of homesickness as he wanders through the ruins of the countryside and meets a doomsaying mystic.

The Rocky Horror Picture Show with live shadowcast by Bit of Mustard!

(1hr 40min R) 1975 US

E-Tickets | Click Here | Sat. August 31st | 11:59pm

The Rocky Horror Picture Show is back at the Art with our all-new shadowcast, A Bit of Mustard! A newly engaged couple suffering from car troubles near an isolated castle and must pay a call to the bizarre residence of Dr. Frank-N-Furter.

The Passion of Joan of Arc, ft. George Sarah Ensemble (LIVE MODERN SCORE)

(1h 21m NR) 1928 Carl Th. Dreyer, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Sunday, September 1st | 6:30pm

The Art Theatre of Long Beach presents the 1928 masterpiece "The Passion of Joan of Arc" by Carl Th. Dreyer (Vampyr, The Phantom Carriage, Mikael) newly restored in 2K with a live original score performed by the nine-piece George Sarah ensemble, a mix of early music choir, string quartet and electronic rhythm/synths.

Sponsored by: Port of Long Beach

Date: Sunday, September 1st

Doors: 5:45pm

Show begins: 6:30pm

Kitchen Lingo presents FOOD & COUNTRY

(1hr 40min NR) 2024 US Laura Gabbert, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Wednesday, September 4th | 7:00pm

Concerned about the impact of the pandemic on independent farmers and chefs, culinary maven Ruth Reichl talks to innovators across the country working to repair America`s broken food system and build a more sustainable future.

See It on 16mm: The Exorcist

(2h 2m R) 1973 US William Friedkin, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Thursday, September 5th | 6:30pm & 9:30pm

Presented for one night only on an ultrarare 16mm film print! When a young girl is possessed by a mysterious entity, her mother seeks the help of two Catholic priests to save her life.

Touch

(2h 1m R) 2024 US Baltasar Kormákur, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Showtimes vary | September 9 - 12

A romantic and thrilling story that spans several decades and continents; Touch follows one man's emotional journey to find his first love who disappeared 50 years ago, before his time runs out.

Widow Clicquot

(2h 39m R) 2024 US Thomas Napper, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Showtimes vary | September 9 - 12

The story behind the Veuve Clicquot champagne family and business that began in the late 18th century.

Long Beach Community Media Arts Double Date!

(1hr 46min PG) US

E-Tickets | Click Here | Thursday, September 12 | 7:30pm

Come enjoy an evening of community based cinema as Long Beach Community Media Arts & The Echo Park Film Center take you on a cinematic journey through the cities that they hold so dear. The Sound we See: A Los Angeles City Symphony (presented on beautiful 16mm film!) + Dear Long Beach: Diary Films Commissioned by LBCMA (Filmed on Super 8mm presented as Digital)

HUMP! Fest 2024: Part Two!

(1hr 30min NR)

E-Tickets | Click Here | September 13 | 6:30pm, 9:30pm

Part Two features 25 MORE brand-new, creative, funny, and sexy adult short films – there’s something for everyone in the second half of this year’s offerings! Experience paranormal and mythical encounters, a mind-bending consent carnival, spine-tingling ASMR, yummy thermal eye candy, and so much more. It’s double the sex, double the kink, (double the pizza?!), and double the FUN!

Kinds of Kindness

(2hr 44min R) 2024 US Yorgos Lanthimos, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Showtimes vary | September 16 - 19

Three stories revolve around a man who tries to take control of his own life, a policeman whose wife seems like a different person, and a woman who searches for someone with a special ability.

THE MALTESE FALCON (Free Member Appreciation Screening Event)

(1hr 40m NR) 1941 US John Huston, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Thursday, Sep. 19th | Doors 6:30 | Film 7:30

Please join us for this special appreciation event for Silver, Gold & Platinum members of the Art Theatre of Long Beach! San Francisco private detective Sam Spade takes on a case that involves him with three eccentric criminals, a gorgeous liar and their quest for a priceless statuette, with the stakes rising after his partner is murdered. Tickets for this event are FREE. Memberships will be verified at the door.

Paul McCartney & Wings: One Hand Clapping, 50th Anniversary!

(67 NR) 1974 UK David Litchfield, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Fri. 9/26, 7:30pm | Sun. 9/28, 2:00pm

This film captured a moment when Paul McCartney and Wings had found and defined their signature sound. Filmed over four days at Abbey Road Studios in August 1974, the film provides an insight into the inner workings of the band as they work and play together in the studio. Including performances of tracks from Wings masterpiece Band on the Run (released in 1973), intimate footage of the band hanging out in the studio, combined with audio interview snippets, the film also includes previously unreleased full footage of a solo acoustic performance by Paul called The Backyard Sessions. In addition to the film, this screening event includes an introduction by Paul McCartney recorded exclusively for movie theatre audiences as well as unseen Polaroids of the band.

Silent Movie Day/A Century of Cinema present THE THIEF OF BAGDAD, 100th Anniversary!

(2h 19) 1924 US Raoul Walsh, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Sunday, September 29th | 2:00pm

We invite you to join our centennial celebration at the historic Art Theatre of Long Beach (est. 1924) for Silent Movie Day 2024 with THE THIEF OF BAGDAD. Presented by our long-running Century of Cinema screening series with pre-film trivia (where you can win fabulous prizes!), a specialty-curated preshow with vintage trailers, advertisements and other surprises, and an introduction by our film programmer. A thief sneaks into a royal palace, where he sees and falls instantly in love with a beautiful princess. Pretending to be a prince, the thief woos the princess, who becomes enamored with him, but when guilt eats at him, the thief confesses to a holy man, who commands him to find a magic chest as penance. As he battles many obstacles to win the chest, the thief uses its powers to save Baghdad from a foreign invader and rescue his beloved.

See It on 16mm: The Texas Chain Saw Massacre, 50th Anniversary!

(1hr 23m R) 1974 US Tobe Hooper, director

E-Tickets | Click Here | Tuesday, October 1st | 9:30pm

In honor of this landmark horror film`s 50th anniversary (to the date! originally release on October 1st, 1974) we`re presenting Tobe Hooper`s masterpiece of terror for one night only on an ultra-rare grindhouse 16mm print! Five friends head out to rural Texas to visit the grave of a grandfather. On the way they stumble across what appears to be a deserted house, only to discover something sinister within. Something armed with a chainsaw.

Nosferatu with LIVE SCORE by the Jack Curtis Dubowsky Ensemble

(1hr 34min NR)

E-Tickets | Click Here | Thurs. 10/31, 7:00pm

A century in the making! Jack Curtis Dubowsky is back at the Art Theatre with his world famous ensemble to celebrate the centennial of Nosferatu; one ghoulish night only, this Halloween! Click for more info about Jack Curtis Dubowski, his ensemble, and Nosferatu!

Enjoy having your name, brand, company or any person you wish to celebrate, laser engraved on a plaque on your very own Art Theatre seat. When you sponsor a seat, we can also acknowledge your gift to a recipient of your choice.

FOOD

RetRoll Sushi LBC

Wednesdays – Sundays 12:00pm-8:30pm

ABOUT RetRoll Sushi ►

WINE

Our intimate wine bar brings you the best in personally chosen wines from around the globe. Enjoy artisanal meats and cheeses to make your visit a complete evening to remember.

ABOUT ART DU VIN ►

VOTED

NUMBER ONE

Voted THE NUMBER ONE INDEPENDENT THEATRE in Los Angeles, the Art opened as a silent movie theatre and included a pipe organ and orchestra pit. It is the oldest operating single screen house in Long Beach. Our art deco, streamline moderne-style historical landmark is famous for its screening of the most imaginative and stimulating independent, documentary, animated, alternative lifestyle, and foreign language films. After one million dollars of loving restoration, the addition of a wine bar and coffee bar, The Art Theatre is the perfect destination for memorable evening.
